This site uses Just the Docs, a documentation theme for Jekyll.

Welcome

Hello world, this is my first Jekyll blog post.

I hope you like it!

see installation guide on jekyll with ruby-bundler zlib1g-dev and so on. sudo apt-get ruby-bundler .....

gem install jekyll bundler see the setup of the bash profile - maybe not usefull when using this setup. jekyll 4.0.0 has some issues which makes it impossible to build at the moment.

bundle init

add to Gemfile -> gem 'jekyll', '3.8.5'

bundle install or just bundle

bundle exec jekylll new . maybe with use of â€“force at the end bundle exec jekyll new . --force this will override and update the gemfile along with creation of all the needed jekyll files.

Then follow the guide for github pages setup in the gemfile comments.

if using theme hosted by a github repo then replace theme with remote_theme and point to the namespace of the repo eg. madssteiner/jekyll-theme or if using github supported theme hav a look here (link to themes) and use the theme alreade in the gemfile.
